title: Survival Model-Based Imputation for Laboratory Non-Detect Data
text: survlab package provides tools imputing non-detect values environmental laboratory data using survival models (including Tobit models). particularly useful environmental engineers, consultants, laboratory professionals working analytical data measurements fall detection limits limits quantification (LOQ). Non-detect values common environmental monitoring programs, contamination assessments, regulatory compliance testing. Traditional approaches like substitution half detection limit can introduce bias affect statistical analyses. package automatically: - Selects best-fitting distribution multiple options - Generates realistic imputed values respective detection limits - Ensures imputed values unique properly constrained - Provides validation diagnostic tools specifically designed laboratory data

title: Survival Model-Based Imputation for Laboratory Non-Detect Data
code: # Install from GitHub (once published) # devtools::install_github("yourusername/survlab")  # Load the package library(survlab) library(survlab) library(data.table) library(ggplot2)

title: Survival Model-Based Imputation for Laboratory Non-Detect Data
text: package includes synthetic environmental laboratory dataset non-detect values:
code: # Load example data data(multi_censored_data)  # Explore the dataset multi_censored_data[, .(   total_samples = .N,   non_detects = sum(censored == 0),   detects = sum(censored == 1),   min_value = min(value),   max_value = max(value) )] #>    total_samples non_detects detects min_value max_value #>            <int>       <int>   <int>     <num>     <num> #> 1:           200          33     167         5  61.62913 # View the different detection limit levels detection_limits <- multi_censored_data[censored == 0, unique(value)] cat("Detection limit levels:", paste(sort(detection_limits), collapse = ", ")) #> Detection limit levels: 5, 8, 15, 25

title: Survival Model-Based Imputation for Laboratory Non-Detect Data
text: main function impute_nondetect() automatically validates data quality, selects best distribution, generates imputed values:
code: # Set seed for reproducibility set.seed(123)  # Perform imputation with parameter validation result <- impute_nondetect(   dt = multi_censored_data,   value_col = "value",    cens_col = "censored",   parameter_col = "parameter",   unit_col = "unit" )

title: Survival Model-Based Imputation for Laboratory Non-Detect Data
text: Use validation function check imputation quality:
code: # Validate the imputation validate_imputation(result) #>      loq count min_imputed max_imputed mean_imputed #>    <num> <int>       <num>       <num>        <num> #> 1:     5    10    3.130343    4.954098     4.411970 #> 2:     8     8    1.777147    7.443072     5.988641 #> 3:    15    12    5.440542   14.849822     9.342475 #> 4:    25     3    5.464246   16.266220    10.072552

title: Survival Model-Based Imputation for Laboratory Non-Detect Data
code: # Look at the first 10 non-detect observations result[censored == 0, .(   original_detection_limit = value,   imputed_value = round(value_imputed, 4),   final_value = round(value_final, 4) )][1:10] #>     original_detection_limit imputed_value final_value #>                        <num>         <num>       <num> #>  1:                       25        8.4872      8.4872 #>  2:                       15       10.3007     10.3007 #>  3:                        5        4.9371      4.9371 #>  4:                        5        4.7981      4.7981 #>  5:                        5        4.4084      4.4084 #>  6:                        5        4.2841      4.2841 #>  7:                       25       16.2662     16.2662 #>  8:                        5        4.6366      4.6366 #>  9:                        8        6.3738      6.3738 #> 10:                        5        4.1271      4.1271

title: Survival Model-Based Imputation for Laboratory Non-Detect Data
text: can create plots visualize imputation results:
code: # Prepare data for plotting plot_data <- rbind(   result[censored == 1, .(value = value, type = "Detected")],   result[censored == 0, .(value = value_imputed, type = "Imputed")] )  # Create histogram ggplot(plot_data, aes(x = value, fill = type)) +   geom_histogram(alpha = 0.7, bins = 30, position = "identity") +   geom_vline(xintercept = attr(result, "max_detection_limit"),               linetype = "dashed", color = "red", linewidth = 1) +   labs(title = "Distribution Comparison: Detected vs Imputed Values",        subtitle = paste("Red line shows maximum detection limit =",                          round(attr(result, "max_detection_limit"), 3)),        x = "Value", y = "Count", fill = "Type") +   theme_minimal() +   scale_fill_manual(values = c("Detected" = "blue", "Imputed" = "orange")) # Q-Q plot to check distribution fit ggplot(result[censored == 0], aes(sample = value_imputed)) +   stat_qq() +    stat_qq_line() +   labs(title = "Q-Q Plot of Imputed Values",        subtitle = paste("Expected distribution:",                          attr(result, "best_distribution"))) +   theme_minimal()

title: Survival Model-Based Imputation for Laboratory Non-Detect Data
text: can specify distributions test adjust validation thresholds:
code: # Test only specific distributions with custom validation result_custom <- impute_nondetect(   dt = multi_censored_data,   dist = c("gaussian", "lognormal", "weibull"),   min_observations = 50,   max_censored_pct = 50 )

title: Survival Model-Based Imputation for Laboratory Non-Detect Data
text: function returns useful model information attributes:
code:
# Extract model information cat("Best distribution:", attr(result, "best_distribution"), "
") #> Best distribution: lognormal cat("Model AIC:", round(attr(result, "aic"), 2), "
") #> Model AIC: 1220.47 cat("Parameter:", attr(result, "parameter"), "
") #> Parameter: Nitrate cat("Unit:", attr(result, "unit"), "
") #> Unit: mg/l NO3 cat("Sample size:", attr(result, "sample_size"), "
") #> Sample size: 200 cat("Censoring percentage:", attr(result, "censored_pct"), "%
") #> Censoring percentage: 16.5 % cat("Detection limits found:", paste(attr(result, "detection_limits"), collapse = ", "), "
") #> Detection limits found: 25, 15, 5, 8 cat("Maximum detection limit:", attr(result, "max_detection_limit"), "
") #> Maximum detection limit: 25  # Access the fitted model model <- attr(result, "best_model") summary(model) #>  #> Call: #> survival::survreg(formula = survival::Surv(x, cens, type = "left") ~  #>     1, dist = d) #>               Value Std. Error    z      p #> (Intercept)  2.4672     0.0429 57.6 <2e-16 #> Log(scale)  -0.5339     0.0556 -9.6 <2e-16 #>  #> Scale= 0.586  #>  #> Log Normal distribution #> Loglik(model)= -608.2   Loglik(intercept only)= -608.2 #> Number of Newton-Raphson Iterations: 6  #> n= 200

title: Survival Model-Based Imputation for Laboratory Non-Detect Data
text: package expects laboratory data specific structure: value_col: Contains either detected values (samples detection limit) detection limit values (non-detect samples) cens_col: Binary indicator 0 = non-detect (detection limit), 1 = detected (detection limit) non-detect observations, value value_col treated detection limit specific analysis, allowing different detection limits across samples analytical methods.

title: Survival Model-Based Imputation for Laboratory Non-Detect Data
text: Multiple Detection Limits: package handles data different detection limits automatically Distribution Selection: Let function test multiple distributions best fit Validation: Always run validate_imputation() check results Seed Setting: Use set.seed() reproducible results reports Large Datasets: package uses data.table efficient memory usage Environmental Data: Works well typical environmental contaminant distributions (often lognormal)

title: Survival Model-Based Imputation for Laboratory Non-Detect Data
text: survlab package provides robust solution imputing non-detect values environmental laboratory data using survival models. automatic distribution selection built-validation ensure reliable results environmental monitoring, contamination assessment, regulatory compliance applications.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Luís Pereira. Author, maintainer. Paulo Infante. Author. Teresa Ferreira. Author. Paulo Quaresma. Author.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Pereira L, Infante P, Ferreira T, Quaresma P (2025). survlab: Survival Model-Based Imputation Laboratory Non-Detect Data. R package version 0.1.0.
code: @Manual{,   title = {survlab: Survival Model-Based Imputation for Laboratory Non-Detect Data},   author = {Luís Pereira and Paulo Infante and Teresa Ferreira and Paulo Quaresma},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.1.0}, }

title: survlab
text: survlab provides functions imputing non-detect values environmental laboratory data using survival models (including Tobit models) automatic distribution selection. designed specifically working analytical data measurements fall detection limits limits quantification (LOQ).

title: survlab
text: Automatic distribution selection: Tests multiple distributions (gaussian, lognormal, weibull, exponential, logistic, log-logistic) selects best fit based AIC Data quality validation: Ensures sufficient sample size (≥25) reasonable censoring percentage (≤75%) Parameter/unit validation: Validates data consistency single parameter datasets Individual detection limit handling: non-detect observation can detection limit Realistic imputation: Generates unique random values respective detection limits Built-validation: Comprehensive validation diagnostic tools designed laboratory data Efficient implementation: Uses data.table fast memory-efficient operations Environmental focus: Designed specifically environmental monitoring contamination assessment data

title: survlab
code: # Load the package library(survlab)

title: survlab
code: library(survlab) library(data.table)  # Load example environmental data data(multi_censored_data)  # Explore the data multi_censored_data[, .(   total_samples = .N,   non_detects = sum(censored == 0),  # 0 = non-detect (below detection limit)   detects = sum(censored == 1)       # 1 = detected (above detection limit) )]  # Perform imputation with parameter validation set.seed(123) result <- impute_nondetect(   dt = multi_censored_data,   value_col = "value",    cens_col = "censored",   parameter_col = "parameter",   unit_col = "unit" )  # Validate results validate_imputation(result)  # View imputed values result[censored == 0, .(   original_detection_limit = value,   imputed_value = round(value_imputed, 4),   final_value = round(value_final, 4) )][1:10]

title: survlab
text: package expects laboratory data following structure: value_col: Contains either detected values (samples detection limit) detection limit values (non-detect samples) cens_col: Binary indicator 0 = non-detect (detection limit), 1 = detected (detection limit) parameter_col (optional): Parameter name (e.g., “Nitrate”, “Lead”, “pH”) unit_col (optional): Unit measurement (e.g., “mg/L”, “ug/L”, “pH units”) non-detect observations, value value_col treated detection limit specific analysis. package validates one parameter one unit present columns provided.

title: survlab
text: main imputation function : - Validates data quality (sample size ≥25, censoring ≤75%) - Ensures parameter unit consistency - Fits multiple survival models different distributions - Selects best model based AIC - Generates random imputed values observation’s detection limit - Returns original data additional imputed value columns

title: survlab
text: Validation function checks: - imputed values respective detection limits - Uniqueness imputed values - Summary statistics detection limit level - Model fit information

title: survlab
code: # After imputation, the data includes new columns: # - value_imputed: Imputed values for non-detect observations # - value_final: Combined detected and imputed values  # Model information is stored as attributes: attr(result, "best_distribution")    # Best-fitting distribution attr(result, "aic")                 # Model AIC attr(result, "parameter")           # Parameter name attr(result, "unit")                # Unit of measurement attr(result, "sample_size")         # Total observations attr(result, "censored_pct")        # Percentage censored attr(result, "detection_limits")    # All detection limits found attr(result, "max_detection_limit") # Highest detection limit attr(result, "best_model")          # Fitted survival model

title: survlab
code: # Adjust validation criteria result <- impute_nondetect(   dt = data,   min_observations = 50,     # Require at least 50 observations   max_censored_pct = 60      # Allow up to 60% censoring )

title: survlab
code: # Test only specific distributions result <- impute_nondetect(   dt = data,   dist = c("gaussian", "lognormal") )

title: survlab
code: # Specify custom column names result <- impute_tobit_random(   dt = data,   value_col = "measurement",   cens_col = "is_below_loq" )

what: Impute Non-Detect Values in Laboratory Data — impute_nondetect
title: Impute Non-Detect Values in Laboratory Data — impute_nondetect
text: function imputes non-detect (censored) values environmental laboratory analytical data using survival models automatic distribution selection. validates data quality requirements fits multiple distributions select best model based AIC. imputed value guaranteed respective detection limit specified minimum value.

title: Impute Non-Detect Values in Laboratory Data — impute_nondetect
code: impute_nondetect(   dt,   value_col = "value",   cens_col = "censored",   parameter_col = NULL,   unit_col = NULL,   dist = c("gaussian", "lognormal", "weibull", "exponential", "logistic", "loglogistic"),   min_observations = 25,   max_censored_pct = 75,   min_value = 0,   verbose = FALSE )

title: Impute Non-Detect Values in Laboratory Data — impute_nondetect
text: dt data.frame data.table containing laboratory analytical data value_col Character string specifying column name containing values cens_col Character string specifying column name containing censoring indicators (0 = non-detect/censored, 1 = detected/observed) parameter_col Character string specifying column name containing parameter names (optional, validation) unit_col Character string specifying column name containing units (optional, validation) dist Character vector distributions test. Options include: "gaussian", "lognormal", "weibull", "exponential", "logistic", "loglogistic" min_observations Minimum number observations required modeling (default: 25) max_censored_pct Maximum percentage censored values allowed (default: 75) min_value Minimum allowable value imputed concentrations (default: 0, use 1e-10 strictly positive) verbose Logical indicating whether display progress messages distribution fitting information (default: FALSE)

title: Impute Non-Detect Values in Laboratory Data — impute_nondetect
text: data.table additional columns: [value_col]_imputed Imputed values non-detect observations [value_col]_final Final values combining original detected imputed non-detect values returned object also attributes containing model information: best_model fitted survival model object best_distribution Name best-fitting distribution detection_limits Vector detection limits found data max_detection_limit highest detection limit (reference) parameter Parameter name (parameter_col provided) unit Unit measurement (unit_col provided) aic AIC value best model sample_size Total number observations censored_pct Percentage censored observations

title: Impute Non-Detect Values in Laboratory Data — impute_nondetect
text: function performs several validation checks: 1. Ensures sufficient sample size (>= min_observations) 2. Checks censoring percentage reasonable (<= max_censored_pct) 3. Validates one parameter unit present (columns provided) 4. Tests multiple distributions selects best based AIC 5. Generates random imputed values observation's detection limit min_value non-detect observations (censored = 0), value value_col treated detection limit specific analysis, allowing different detection limits across samples analytical methods. IMPORTANT: function applied data containing ONE parameter time. Different environmental parameters different distributions modeled together. verbose = FALSE, function operates silently except critical errors, making suitable batch processing multiple parameters.

title: Impute Non-Detect Values in Laboratory Data — impute_nondetect
code: # Load example data data(multi_censored_data)  # Basic imputation with default settings set.seed(123) result <- impute_nondetect(   dt = multi_censored_data,   value_col = "value",   cens_col = "censored",   verbose = FALSE )  # View imputed values for non-detects head(result[censored == 0, .(value, value_imputed, value_final)]) #>    value value_imputed value_final #>    <num>         <num>       <num> #> 1:    25      8.487192    8.487192 #> 2:    15     10.300671   10.300671 #> 3:     5      4.937120    4.937120 #> 4:     5      4.798058    4.798058 #> 5:     5      4.408386    4.408386 #> 6:     5      4.284067    4.284067  # Check best distribution selected attr(result, "best_distribution") #> [1] "lognormal"  # With parameter and unit validation result <- impute_nondetect(   dt = multi_censored_data,   value_col = "value",   cens_col = "censored",   parameter_col = "parameter",   unit_col = "unit" )  # For strictly positive values (avoiding exactly zero) result <- impute_nondetect(   dt = multi_censored_data,   value_col = "value",   cens_col = "censored",   min_value = 1e-10,   verbose = FALSE )

what: Environmental Laboratory Nitrate Data with Non-Detects — multi_censored_data
title: Environmental Laboratory Nitrate Data with Non-Detects — multi_censored_data
text: synthetic dataset containing environmental nitrate measurements non-detect values, generated lognormal distribution. dataset represents typical water quality monitoring data environmental laboratory, designed demonstrating survival model-based imputation techniques.

title: Environmental Laboratory Nitrate Data with Non-Detects — multi_censored_data
code: multi_censored_data

title: Environmental Laboratory Nitrate Data with Non-Detects — multi_censored_data
text: data.table 200 rows 4 variables: parameter Character string indicating chemical parameter ("Nitrate") unit Character string indicating unit measurement ("mg/l NO3") value Numeric values representing either detected measurements                detection limits non-detect observations censored Integer indicator 0 = non-detect (detection limit),                   1 = detected (detection limit)

title: Environmental Laboratory Nitrate Data with Non-Detects — multi_censored_data
text: Synthetic data generated package demonstration, based typical         environmental water quality monitoring programs

title: Environmental Laboratory Nitrate Data with Non-Detects — multi_censored_data
text: dataset simulates real-world environmental water quality data nitrate measurements certain detection limits reported non-detects. data includes: Single parameter (Nitrate) consistent units (mg/l NO3) Multiple detection limit levels reflecting different analytical conditions Realistic distribution detected vs non-detect values (83.5 Detection limits ranging 5 25 mg/l NO3 Lognormal distribution typical environmental contaminant data non-detect observations (censored = 0), 'value' column contains detection limit specific analysis. detected measurements (censored = 1), 'value' column contains actual measured nitrate concentration.

title: Environmental Laboratory Nitrate Data with Non-Detects — multi_censored_data
code: data(multi_censored_data)  # Basic data exploration multi_censored_data[, .(   total_samples = .N,   non_detects = sum(censored == 0),   detects = sum(censored == 1) )] #>    total_samples non_detects detects #>            <int>       <int>   <int> #> 1:           200          33     167  # View parameter and unit information multi_censored_data[, .(   parameter = unique(parameter),   unit = unique(unit) )] #>    parameter     unit #>       <char>   <char> #> 1:   Nitrate mg/l NO3  # View detection limit levels multi_censored_data[censored == 0, unique(value)] #> [1] 25 15  5  8  # Apply survival model imputation result <- impute_nondetect(multi_censored_data,                           parameter_col = "parameter",                           unit_col = "unit") validate_imputation(result) #> === Laboratory Non-Detect Imputation Validation === #> Parameter: Nitrate #> Unit: mg/l NO3 #> Sample size: 200 #> Censoring percentage: 16.5 % #> ✓ All imputed values are strictly below their respective detection limits #> ✓ All imputed values are unique #>  #> Summary by limit of quantification level: #>      loq count min_imputed max_imputed mean_imputed #>    <num> <int>       <num>       <num>        <num> #> 1:     5    10    2.908333    4.851259     4.019263 #> 2:     8     8    3.655422    7.576604     5.746114 #> 3:    15    12    6.320140   13.368316     8.867565 #> 4:    25     3    5.466556   12.248956     8.491381 #> Total non-detect observations: 33 #> Best distribution: lognormal #> Model AIC: 1220.47 #> Detection limits found: 5, 8, 15, 25

what: Validate Laboratory Non-Detect Imputation Results — validate_imputation
title: Validate Laboratory Non-Detect Imputation Results — validate_imputation
text: function validates quality non-detect value imputation checking imputed values respective limits quantification providing comprehensive summary statistics model diagnostics.

title: Validate Laboratory Non-Detect Imputation Results — validate_imputation
code: validate_imputation(   dt_imputed,   value_col = "value",   cens_col = "censored",   verbose = TRUE )

title: Validate Laboratory Non-Detect Imputation Results — validate_imputation
text: dt_imputed data.table returned impute_nondetect value_col Character string specifying column name containing original values cens_col Character string specifying column name containing censoring indicators verbose Logical indicating whether print validation results console (default: TRUE)

title: Validate Laboratory Non-Detect Imputation Results — validate_imputation
text: Invisibly returns input data.table. verbose = TRUE, prints validation   results console including: Whether imputed values detection limits Number duplicate imputed values () Summary statistics detection limit level Model fit information

title: Validate Laboratory Non-Detect Imputation Results — validate_imputation
text: function checks: imputed values strictly respective limits quantification Uniqueness imputed values Summary statistics limits quantification level Model fit information including parameter unit details Dataset characteristics (sample size, censoring percentage)

title: Validate Laboratory Non-Detect Imputation Results — validate_imputation
code: data(multi_censored_data) result <- impute_nondetect(multi_censored_data, verbose = FALSE) validate_imputation(result) #> === Laboratory Non-Detect Imputation Validation === #> Sample size: 200 #> Censoring percentage: 16.5 % #> ✓ All imputed values are strictly below their respective detection limits #> ✓ All imputed values are unique #>  #> Summary by limit of quantification level: #>      loq count min_imputed max_imputed mean_imputed #>    <num> <int>       <num>       <num>        <num> #> 1:     5    10    1.714617    4.903044     3.373300 #> 2:     8     8    4.146878    7.799514     6.466325 #> 3:    15    12    3.755751   11.857531     8.251673 #> 4:    25     3   13.599483   22.597835    18.331666 #> Total non-detect observations: 33 #> Best distribution: lognormal #> Model AIC: 1220.47 #> Detection limits found: 5, 8, 15, 25  # Silent validation for batch processing validate_imputation(result, verbose = FALSE)

title: survlab 0.1.0
